result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javion S Harvey

records.addlTxt:
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Javion S Harvey in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 01.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Javion S Harvey not in court. 
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 11-01-2022.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant left the sheriff's department before he was booked.

Defendant Javion S Harvey not in court.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant is currently being booked.  Court ordered the bench warrant withdrawn.

signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Javion S Harvey in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning requests a status hearing date.  Court ordered the defendant to report to the CJF for book and release and then go to Intake to clear the bench warrant.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Javion S Harvey not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER/ JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
He failed to be booked and released by 3/19/2022.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/19/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Javion S Harvey in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/17/22 @ 2p
